p: The formation process of compound 7 can be inferred in Figure 6. Compound 7 eluted at 11.825 min had the precursor ion [M+H] + at m/ z 331.0809. The [M+H] + ion eliminated 15 Da (CH 3) to produce m/ z 316.05637. MS2 fragment at m/ z 119.04902 (C 8H 7O [M] +) was 211 Da (C 9H 7O 6) less than that of the parent ion. Moreover, diagnostic fragment ions at m/ z 121.02834 were generated by the fragmentation of precursor ion cleaved at position C. The fragment ions of compound 7 were compared with the reported data, the diagnostic ion at m/ z 316.05637 [ 43]. Thus, the compound 7 was identified as cirsiliol.
